Authors: Fang Wu, Yu Cheng Dai, Long Fei Fan
Title:
Calocera tibetica sp. nov. (Dacrymycetales, Basidiomycota)
from southwestern China
Abstract:
A new gelatinous species, Calocera tibetica, is described
from southwestern China based on morphological and molecular evidence.
It is characterized by stipitate, gelatinous-cartilaginous,
dichotomously branched, dendroid or staghorn-like basidioma with blunt
tips, subclavate to clavate basidia measuring 45.053.0 × 4.86.0 µm,
hyaline, oblong ellipsoid to navicular, 34-septate mature basidiospores
measuring 9.014.0 × 5.06.3 μm. In the phylogeny, the new species is
closely related to C. viscosa and C. cornea based on ITS sequences, but
C. viscosa has basidioma with sharp tips, pale yellow, 1-septate mature
basidiospores; C. cornea has cylindrical, subulate, slightly branched
basidioma, tinted, cylindrical to slightly curved-cylindrical, 1-septate
mature basidiospores measuring 710 × 34.5 μm. The new species is unique
by its 34-septate mature basidiospores among species of Calocera.
